The mind may be so elevated that divine thoughts and contemplations come to be as natural as the breath. All the faculties of the soul are to be trained. We must do God's work intelligently. We must know the truth; and to know this is to know God. . . .Educate mind and heart to pure, elevated, holy thoughts.--Letter 74, 1896, pp. 4, 11, 13. (To the Managers and Workers in Our Institutions," no date.)
